official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that trusts established for the payment of product liability claims, professional design liability claims, and related expenses shall be exempt from income tax, and that a deduction shall be allowed for contributions to such trusts.
short_title: Product and Professional Design Liability Insurance Tax Equity Act of 1981

summary.text: Product and Professional Design Liability Insurance Tax Equity Act of 1981 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to qualify trusts established for the payment of product liability claims, professional design liability claims, and related expenses as tax-exempt organizations. Allows a tax deduction for contributions to such trusts only to the extent that such contributions exceed the reasonable cost, as determined under Treasury regulations, of design liability insurance.
